Eddy Higgins

Method Detail

extractComments

public static org.w3c.dom.Comment[] extractComments(org.w3c.dom.Document document)
This method will extract all of the comment nodes from an XML Document. The comments are returned as a Comment[] (in the order that they were encountered in the Document.

Parameters:
document - DOM Document
Returns:
Comment[] of the comments from the document.

extractComments

public static org.w3c.dom.Comment[] extractComments(java.lang.String xmlFile,
                                                    boolean validate)
                                             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
This method will extract the comments from an XML file. All of the real work is done by extractComments(Document document).

Parameters:
xmlFile - XML File to use
validate - If true, validate external DTD definitions.
Returns:
Comment[] of comments from the document.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there's a problem with parsing
java.io.IOException - if there's a problem reading the file.

extractComments

public static org.w3c.dom.Comment[] extractComments(java.lang.String xmlFile)
                                             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
This method will extract the comments from an XML file without validating external DTDs. It is exactly equivalent to extractComments(xmlFile,false);

Parameters:
xmlFile - XML File to use
Returns:
Comment[] of comments from the document.
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there's a problem with parsing
java.io.IOException - if there's a problem reading the file.

format

public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String xml,
                                      boolean isFragment)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      org.dom4j.DocumentException
Uses a Dom4j SAXReader to apply formatting to the supplied XML fragment. In this case we use a prettyprinter to indent the tags.

Parameters:
xml - The XML to be formatted (can be just a fragment)
isFragment - If you supplied a XML fragment then this must be set to true so that the writer doesn't output an XML declaration
Returns:
the formatted XML
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem applying the formatting
org.dom4j.DocumentException - if there was a problem with the XML

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
Simple sanity test method.

Parameters:
argv - List of XML files to examine for comments.

getElementByTagName

public static java.util.ArrayList getElementByTagName(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                      java.lang.String tagName,
                                                      java.lang.String attributeName,
                                                      java.lang.String attributeValue)
Searches through the supplied Document for tags matching the supplied tagName with an attribute with the name/value pair supplied

Parameters:
doc - the document to search
tagName - the tag name to search for
attributeName - the attribute name to search the tag for
attributeValue - the attribute value to search the tag for
Returns:
a list of the matches

getElementListValues

public static java.util.ArrayList getElementListValues(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
Searches below the supplied Node for a "list" tag and then retrieves the contents of the "value" tag(s) under that. Note that if there is more than one "list" under the node then we will take the values from the first one only.

Parameters:
node - acts as the root for the seach
Returns:
list of Strings corresponding to the contents of the "value" tag(s)
